intro: Zeuxine elmeri, commonly known as the Elmer's zeuxine, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes buttercups and other herbaceous plants. The plant produces showy, violet-blue flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late summer. Its leaves are palmately divided, with a rough texture and a distinct, bitter taste. Zeuxine elmeri thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
